title: When Are the 9/11 Victim Compensation Fund Deadlines?
sub_head: The deadline to register is July 29 for certain individuals. Funds for all current and future eligible claims will run until 2090.
body:
As the 20th anniversary of the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks approaches, so does an important deadline for a subset of individuals to register for the September 11th Victim Compensation Fund to potentially receive future benefits related to their illness.
The VCF was established to provide federal support to cover medical claims by those who became sick after the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks. Eligibility includes individuals, or those representing a deceased individual, who were present at the World Trade Center and surrounding areas; the crash site at the Pentagon; and the United Flight 93 crash site near Shanksville, Pa., between Sept. 11, 2001, and May 30, 2002.
It is estimated that around 400,000 people were exposed to caustic dust and toxic pollutants in the 9/11 dust and debris cloud, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. Individuals must have been diagnosed with an illness related to the attacks.
There are two main deadlines involving filing a claim for the fund: a registration deadline and a claim filing deadline. “Registration is the first step in the claim filing process and it simply preserves your right to file a claim in the future,” according to the VCF website.
Registration deadlines vary based on individual circumstances, according to the VCF.
